title: 港大醫學院開始停課了

replies.msg:
學生唔畀返去威爾斯同瑪麗

IMPORTANT
To: All HKUMed staff and students
In association with the first Wuhan Novel Coronavirus case confirmed in Hong Kong today, the Faculty has decided to suspend ALL teaching within ALL hospital compounds (including non-clinical areas) with effect from tomorrow, January 23, 2020, until further notice. The measure applies to bedside teaching at wards, out-patient clinics, clinical attachments, practicum, tutorials, lectures and so on, to be conducted at hospitals for all students in the Faculty.
Classes to be held on Sassoon Road Campus will continue as scheduled.
The Faculty will reassess the situation and update students with the teaching and learning arrangements after the Chinese New Year.
LKS Faculty of Medicine
https://www.facebook.com/HKUMed/posts/2921541974563021

中大應該都停，但係未出消息
返返去沙士嗰時，當時幾個醫學生檢查完病人後中招

2003-03-10

沙田威爾斯親王醫院8A病房醫護人員及病人相繼出現發燒及肺炎徵狀，威院一度將病房封鎖；其後證實多達50名醫護、17名醫學生、28名病人及42名訪客在8A病房感染沙士；而一名3月15日在8A留醫病人其後被證實為淘大源頭感染者。

replies.msg:
Dear students,

I am sure you would have learnt the news that the first case of Wuhan pneumonia or novel coronavirus (2019-nCoV) infection in Hong Kong was just diagnosed. The patient is now being treated at the Princess Margaret Hospital. Let’s wish him all the best.

In light of the recent rapidly evolving situation and in order to safeguard our students' well-being, the Deanery has made the decision that with immediate effect, the clinical teaching of Year 4, 5 and 6 students would be suspended. Please note that all clinical attachments in PWH and other HA hospitals in the next two days (23 January 2020 and 24 January 2020) before the Chinese New Year would be cancelled. The Faculty will assess the situation and inform you about the subsequent plans before the end of Chinese New Year public holidays.
Your health and safety are our priorities. At this stage, personal hygiene and infection control measures are of utmost importance. Should you develop any symptoms of upper respiratory tract infection, please make sure you will wear a mask and seek medical help. We shall keep up the communication and update you of our plans for clinical teaching and assessments should we need to activate our contingency plans. Do also let us know if you have any concerns and need any support.

Professor Paul BS LAI
Director, Office of Medical Education
Classes to be held on Sassoon Road Campus will continue as scheduled.

2003-03-10

沙田威爾斯親王醫院8A病房醫護人員及病人相繼出現發燒及肺炎徵狀，威院一度將病房封鎖；其後證實多達50名醫護、17名醫學生、28名病人及42名訪客在8A病房感染沙士；而一名3月15日在8A留醫病人其後被證實為淘大源頭感染者。

replies.msg:
2003年一名中國人係內地將SARS帶入香港，做成1799人感染，其中299人死亡，當中包括8位前線既醫護人員都因SARS失去生命。康復者同時因為大量施用類固醇等藥物做成不可逆轉的後遺症，例如:骨枯、肺纖維化、抵抗力下降等。2003年後因為經濟環境下滑，所以當時既香港政府同中國政府簽訂左CEPA協議，開始自由行以希望刺激經濟，結果做成大量雙非、走水貨等等民生問題。行業不再多元化，變得集中某些行業，中國利用佢既經濟霸權，令你難以擺脫對中國依賴，有些行業更加會希望中國有更多城市開放自由行。CEPA協議猶如毒品一樣，令香港吸食左後萬劫不復，每況越下，只會令你越黎越依賴，越難戒走。

而一切原因就係2003年中共政府隱瞞SARS疫情。依家中共重施固技，令你難以擺脫對中國依賴。

1月23日 23：59死線！光復高鐵！
https://lih.kg/eMBMHT

Please note that all clinical attachments in PWH and other HA hospitals in the next two days (23 January 2020 and 24 January 2020) before the Chinese New Year would be cancelled. The Faculty will assess the situation and inform you about the subsequent plans before the end of Chinese New Year public holidays.
Your health and safety are our priorities. At this stage, personal hygiene and infection control measures are of utmost importance. Should you develop any symptoms of upper respiratory tract infection, please make sure you will wear a mask and seek medical help. We shall keep up the communication and update you of our plans for clinical teaching and assessments should we need to activate our contingency plans. Do also let us know if you have any concerns and need any support.

Professor Paul BS LAI
Director, Office of Medical Education

quote.msg:
Dear students,

I am sure you would have learnt the news that the first case of Wuhan pneumonia or novel coronavirus (2019-nCoV) infection in Hong Kong was just diagnosed. The patient is now being treated at the Princess Margaret Hospital. Let’s wish him all the best.

In light of the recent rapidly evolving situation and in order to safeguard our students' well-being, the Deanery has made the decision that with immediate effect, the clinical teaching of Year 4, 5 and 6 students would be suspended. Please note that all clinical attachments in PWH and other HA hospitals in the next two days (23 January 2020 and 24 January 2020) before the Chinese New Year would be cancelled. The Faculty will assess the situation and inform you about the subsequent plans before the end of Chinese New Year public holidays.
Your health and safety are our priorities. At this stage, personal hygiene and infection control measures are of utmost importance. Should you develop any symptoms of upper respiratory tract infection, please make sure you will wear a mask and seek medical help. We shall keep up the communication and update you of our plans for clinical teaching and assessments should we need to activate our contingency plans. Do also let us know if you have any concerns and need any support.

Professor Paul BS LAI
Director, Office of Medical Education

quote.msg:
Dear students,

I am sure you would have learnt the news that the first case of Wuhan pneumonia or novel coronavirus (2019-nCoV) infection in Hong Kong was just diagnosed. The patient is now being treated at the Princess Margaret Hospital. Let’s wish him all the best.

In light of the recent rapidly evolving situation and in order to safeguard our students' well-being, the Deanery has made the decision that with immediate effect, the clinical teaching of Year 4, 5 and 6 students would be suspended. Please note that all clinical attachments in PWH and other HA hospitals in the next two days (23 January 2020 and 24 January 2020) before the Chinese New Year would be cancelled. The Faculty will assess the situation and inform you about the subsequent plans before the end of Chinese New Year public holidays.
Your health and safety are our priorities. At this stage, personal hygiene and infection control measures are of utmost importance. Should you develop any symptoms of upper respiratory tract infection, please make sure you will wear a mask and seek medical help. We shall keep up the communication and update you of our plans for clinical teaching and assessments should we need to activate our contingency plans. Do also let us know if you have any concerns and need any support.

Professor Paul BS LAI
Director, Office of Medical Education

Dear students,

I am sure you would have learnt the news that the first case of Wuhan pneumonia or novel coronavirus (2019-nCoV) infection in Hong Kong was just diagnosed. The patient is now being treated at the Princess Margaret Hospital. Let’s wish him all the best.

In light of the recent rapidly evolving situation and in order to safeguard our students' well-being, the Deanery has made the decision that with immediate effect, the clinical teaching of Year 4, 5 and 6 students would be suspended. Please note that all clinical attachments in PWH and other HA hospitals in the next two days (23 January 2020 and 24 January 2020) before the Chinese New Year would be cancelled. The Faculty will assess the situation and inform you about the subsequent plans before the end of Chinese New Year public holidays.
Your health and safety are our priorities. At this stage, personal hygiene and infection control measures are of utmost importance. Should you develop any symptoms of upper respiratory tract infection, please make sure you will wear a mask and seek medical help. We shall keep up the communication and update you of our plans for clinical teaching and assessments should we need to activate our contingency plans. Do also let us know if you have any concerns and need any support.

Professor Paul BS LAI
Director, Office of Medical Education
